title: Hong Kong: Wine and Dine Month Set for 22 October - 30 November 2015
text:
Hong Kong: Wine and Dine Month Set for 22 October - 30 November 2015 
Foodie Friday 
Hong Kong Wine and Dine Month is a 40 day celebration of food and beverage, which kicks off with a 4 day festival, which moves across Victoria Harbour from Kowloon back to Hong Kong Island this year. Hong Kong Wine and Dine Festival moves from Kowloon back to the waterfront on Hong Kong Island. Photo Credit: Dixon Ko. 
Hong Kong Wine and Dine Month is a 40 day celebration of food and beverage. There will be a 4 day outdoor wine and dine festival followed by a series of culinary events, which will take place all over town. 
Running from 22 to 25 October 2015, the Wine and Dine Festival will be staged on the waterfront in Central on Hong Kong Island. 
More than 300 booths will serve quality wines and beers from around the world as well as mouth-watering dishes. 
Many of the booths will be operated by some of Hong Kong's top food and beverage outlets - both hotel restaurants and free-standing eateries. 
One of the highlights will be the Riedel Grand Tasting Pavilion, where premium wines will be served in Riedel's sculpted glassware. 
There will be a large outdoor stage with live music and other kinds of entertainment.. 
The festivities will continue until the end of November, with street carnivals, restaurant festivals, and various kinds of wine and dine promotions, which will be held all over town. 
International Wine and Spirits Fair 
One of the most important ancillary events will be the 8th Annual Hong Kong International Wine and Spirits Fair, which will be held at the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre in Wanchai from 5 to 7 November 2015. 
The Wine and Spirits Fair is targeted primarily at the trade and will include competitions, conferences, wine tastings, and master classes. 
Many of the attendees will be buyers sourcing wines and related products and services for their businesses. 
There were 1,007 exhibitors from 38 countries and regions at the fair last year, with 19,926 buyers from 75 countries and regions attending the event. 
The first 2 days are open only to the trade. The public is welcome to attend the fair's final day on Saturday 7 November. 
The Hong Kong International Wine and Spirits Fair is organized by the Hong Kong Trade Development Council.
